did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Karen Kuykendall papers, 1923-1982
did.abstract: Contains historical material relating to Adolf Hitler and the Third Reich, with emphasis on the character and personality of Adolf Hitler and the decorative arts and relics of the Third Reich.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Karen Kuykendall papers(MS 243).Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

relatedmaterial.p: Some volumes were previously cataloged separately under the following numbers: MS 244 through MS 252, MS 255 through MS 258, MS 260, and MS 261.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series

list.item: Series I: Biographical Materials and Articles, 1972-1982
Series III: Material Relating to Adolf Hitler and the Third Reich, 1923-1975
Series IV: Materials Relating to the Art and Architecture of the Third Reich, 1932-1971

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains historical material relating to Adolf Hitler and the Third Reich, with emphasis on the character and personality of Adolf Hitler and the decorative arts and relics of the Third Reich. Includes chiefly clippings, political cartoons, articles, posters, photographs, and miscellaneous memorabilia, 1923-1971. Also includes correspondence and questionnaires from interviews by Karen Kuykendall with individuals who knew Adolf Hitler, including Arno Breker, Gerhard Engel, Hermann Giesler, Heinrich Heim, Richard Schulze-Kossens, Dr. Werner Naumann, Albert Speer, and Gerdy Troost, 1971-1978.

did.unittitle: Series I: Biographical Materials and Articles, 1972-1982
"Recollections by Karen Kuykendall: Growing up in San Diego, California during the 1930's." 1982
Various articles on the Third Reich. By Karen Kuykendall. No Date

"Hunting: The Joys and Sorrows of Being a Third Reich Relics Collector." Includes mostly black and white photographs and color slides of military decorations and other Third Reich collectibles. Also includes correspondence from various dealers, museums and collectors. By Karen Kuykendall. No Date
Original holograph translations of articles from Das III Reich. By Karen Kuykendall. No Date
Series II: Interviews and Correspondence, 1971-1978
Interview notes. 1973
Correspondence: Professor Arno Breker. 1971-1974
Correspondence: General Gerhard Engel, Professor Herman Giesler, Dr. Werner Naumann. 1971-1974
Correspondence: Dr. Hans Karl von Hasselbach. 1973-1977
Correspondence: Heinrich Heim. 1973-1978
Correspondence: Richard Schulze-Kossens. 1972-1978
Correspondence: Albert Speer. 1971-1974
Correspondence: Gerdy Troost. 1973-1978
Correspondence: John Toland, author of Adolf Hitler. 1972-1977
Series III: Materials Relating to Adolf Hitler and the Third Reich, 1923-1975
"Hitler in American and British cartoons." 1939-1940
"Hitler in British cartoons." 1932-1945
"Cartoons by Marcus." Clippings of political cartoons by Edwin Marcus from the New York Times. 1938-1945
Articles from Life magazine, The New York Times, Look magazine, the Police Gazette and others. No Date
Articles from Das Illustrierte Blatt, Signal, Collier's and L'Illustration magazines. 1933-1942
Articles and clippings from Look magazine, The Illustrated London News, The New York Times Book Review, and various newspapers. 1933-1975
"The Third Reich in Caricature." Der Simplicus 1:34. 1934
"Adolf Hitler: a questionnaire with essays" by Karen Kuykendall. One bound volume and one copy with author's handwritten notes. 1974
"The Fuehrer's face." Photographs and clippings of Adolf Hitler. 1923-1945
Articles from Readers Digest. 1962

Articles from Readers Digest, Coronet Magazine, Current History, Pageant Magazine, and Forum magazine. Also includes Flemming, George and Don Tapisco. Terror over Berchtesgaden. Booktab; no. 11. New York, NY. 1936-1960

Excerpts from various books: Waln, Nora. Reaching for the Stars. [Boston: Little, Brown and Co., 1940?]; Lochner, Louis Paul. What about Germany? [London: Hodder & Stoughton, 1943?]; Taylor, Henry J. Men and Power. [New York: Dodd, Mead, 1946?]. No Date
Articles from: Current Biography, Harper's, American Historical Review, The Living Age, and Current History. 1936-1955

Miscellaneous Publications of the Terramare Office, Berlin: Bouhler, Philipp. Adolf Hitler: A short sketch of his life. Terramare publications; no 1. Sadila-Montau, Hans Heinz. German Political Profiles. Terramare publications; no 2. Adolf Hitler from Speeches, Terramare publications; no 8-10. Grimm, Freidrich. Versailles in Liquidation. Terramare publications; no 3. Schinnerer, Erich. German Law and Legislation. Terramare publications; no 4. Frercks, Rudolf. German Population Policy. Terramare publications; no 5. Edel, Fritz. German Labour Service. 2nd edition. Terramare publications; no 6. Reher, Werner. Social Welfare in Germany. Terramare publications; no 7. 1938

Excerpts from various books: Sinclair, Thornton. "The Nazi Party Rally at Nuremberg." Public Opinion Quarterly (October 1938); Henderson, Sir Neville. Failure of a Mission: Berlin 1937-1939. New York, N.Y. : G. P. Putnam's Sons, 1940. No Date
"Hitler: miscellaneous articles." No Date
Clippings from newspapers and magazines. No Date
Various articles and clippings from Time magazine and others. No Date
Articles from Playboy magazine, Harper's magazine, The Atlantic Monthly and various other popular magazines. No Date
Clippings from The Los Angeles Times. September-December 1955
Clippings from German newspapers. 1933
Various articles, and clippings from American newspapers and magazines. No Date
Series IV: Materials Relating to the Art and Architecture of the Third Reich, 1932-1971

separatedmaterial.p: Original items from box 5, vol. 5-7, Memorabilia of the Third Reich, are located in the vault.

did.unittitle: Bird, Kenneth. "Posters by Fougasse." Color posters from the 'Careless Talk Costs Lives' series. 1941
Color Slides: Art history color slides mostly Medieval, Baroque, and 19th-20th century architecture. Third Reich Artifacts. No Date
"The Fuehrer's Treasures: Decorative Arts of the Third Reich" by Karen Kuykendall. No Date
"Art of the Third Reich." Chiefly clippings, photographs and memorabilia such as postcards and uniform charts. 1932-1945

Memorabilia of the Third Reich. Includes some originals and some photocopies of photographs, postcards, stationary, stamps, currency, calling cards, propaganda leaflets and other memorabilia from Nazi Germany. The originals of the photocopied items have been placed in the vault. 1932-1945
"Posters of the Third Reich." No Date
Doehle, Heinrich. Orders and Decorations of the Third Reich. Berlin: Berliner Buch - und Zeitschriften Verlag. English translation by Dr. Doehle, with addenda compiled by Karen Kuykendall. 1943
"Art in the Third Reich". Magazine of Art. Washington, D.C. : The American Federation of Arts. October 1945

Articles: "Third Reich Art." "Interview with Albert Speer." Playboy magazine 18: 6 (June 1971): 69-204. "Arno Breker: Sculptor Laureate of the Third Reich." The Sunday Times Magazine (November 7, 1971). No Date
"German Paintings of World War II." No Date
"Designs for Nazi Daggers." No Date
The Medal Collector. Orders and Medals Society of America. 1957-1959
Series V: Miscellaneous Oversize Materials, 1928-1971
"The Adventures of Adolf Hitler." Volume I. 1928-1939
"The Adventures of Adolf Hitler." Volume II. 1940-1942
"The Adventures of Adolf Hitler." Volume III. 1943
"The Adventures of Adolf Hitler." Volume IV. 1944-1945
"Hitler in Soviet Cartoons," with English captions. 1941-1945
Articles and clippings from The New York Times, Collier's, the Saturday Evening Post and others. 1933-1971
"Adolf Hitler." Photos from the National Archives and Library of Congress. No Date
"Hitler in Mexican cartoons." Clippings primarily from Hoy magazine (Spanish). 1940-1945

Artur Szyk, Illustrations by Arthur Szyk. Contains full color political cartoons from various sources including Collier's magazine. Also includes lithographic prints of the 'United Nations Series' of stamp album title pages created beginning in 1945 for Canadian philatelist and entrepreneur Kasimir Bileski. 1941-1948

"The Third Reich." Clippings from newspapers and magazines. Also includes photographs and posters, from American, British, and German publications, and original posters by Karen Kuykendall. Materials are in German and English. No Date
